result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Lydia L Retzlaff was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Barron County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Taycheedah Correctional Institution as reception facility.   Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program. Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Concurrent with: Washburn County Case 12CF79.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Must submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.  Enclosed is an assessment information sheet.  Also enclosed is an assessment referral form.  To set up an appointment, call the number on the assessment information sheet.

6th offense.
Concurrent with: Washburn County Case 12CF79

Court asked Lydia to explain why she was in custody today and she explained she relapsed on Friday night on alcohol and meth.
Relates on issues that caused her to relapse and for lying to the team that she smoked pot instead of meth as she was embarrassed to admit to meth.  
Court advises Lydia to get beyond her feelings and she can't just function on feelings and to use her intelligence to make better choices for her recovery.  
Lydia will be released from custody tomorrow morning and is to connect with Dan and Kara upon release.

$600 fine + costs
36 month DL revocation
36 month IID
